fields.description:
# Try to attach a file.
# [Bug] Safari sometimes just sits there with the trobber spinning. Once this happens you have to close the dialog and try to attach again. 
# Repeat until it breaks.

This does not happen very time. Check out the [^movie.mov].

My environment is a little unique. I am using HTTPS -> Apache -> HTTP -> Tomcat. 

Looking at the Apache Access logs it looks like the request to {{POST /secure/AttachTemporaryFile.jspa HTTP/1.1"}} is just not being made when this error occurs. Does this have something to do with the "magic" form we are creating?
fields.summary: Safari intermittently fails to attach files

JT lets tighten this up.

fields.description:
When setting permissions on a comment, clicking the padlock icon once brings up the menu. Clicking it again does not dismiss it.

I've marked it as major because:
* I personally find it very annoying, 
* It's a regression from 4.1.2, 
* Every other drop-down menu in JIRA closes on the second click (with the exception of Create Issue, which has a Cancel link). 
* Now that the permission value is no longer displayed, the users will need to open and close the menu just to see what its value is set to.
fields.summary: Clicking the permissions drop-down icon does not dismiss the drop-down

fields.description:
The issue service isn't doing anything use with regards to required fields when you do validateTransition.

If the field isn't present it copies the existing value from the issue.

Even if we fix that, it will be broken at least for resolutions because it ends up calling orderableField.validateParams which checks isRequired() except according to JRA-16112 the resolution can't be marked isRequired (except for on resolution when it magically is required).

This whole thing needs to be sorted out and clearly we'll need a bit of testing to hopefully ensure we get all the cases :(
fields.summary: transitions with required fields don't work properly

fields.description: In 4.2 we force people to restore that data from the "{{$JIRA_HOME/import}}" directory. If someone types in a file with a path "/this/path/doesnot/exists.xml" JIRA will actually try to restore "{{$JIRA_HOME/import/exists.xml}}". If the user types in a file with a path I would expect JIRA to give you an error saying "we only import files from JIRA.HOME blah blah ... import....". We also have the same problem on the "SetupImport" screen, however, its behavior is slightly different. It still lets you type in a path to restore a file. For example if the user types in {{/this/path/doesnot/exists.xml}} JIRA will: # Try to find {{/this/path/doesnot/exists.xml}}. # [BUG] If this does not exist, try {{$JIRA_HOME/import/exists.xml}}. To me this is what should happen when the user types in $FILE: # Try to find {{$FILE}} # If this does not exist and {{$FILE}} has no path then try {{$JIRA_HOME/import/$FILE}} # If was unable to find file, then report to the user all files that we tried to locate.
fields.summary: Typing an import with a path should fail in 'XmlRestore'

fields.description:
I don't like the idea of sending in POST body username to add such watcher, while to remove a watcher we use URI for DELETE method.

To be consistent and more intuitive for RESTful geeks, I think we should:
- PUT <issue-key>/watchers/<username> to add a watcher
- DELETE <issue-key>/watchers/<username> to remove a watcher
- POST <issue-key>/watchers to add yourself as a watcher 
- DELETE <issue-key>/watchers to remove yourself from the watcher list
The last two are optional, although the most typical scenario is adding yourself as a watcher or removing yourself. With potentially crazy authentication scenarios (like OAuth or SSL client cert) rest client may not even know its name, so he will need to first get his current session details just to find out what his username is and only then use this name to add or remove themselves as a watcher. That's an unnecessary call, which we could avoid by adding this POST without username.

Thoughts?
fields.summary: Improving consistency of watchers related methods

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce behaviour:
# Set up a test instance on the same host as already running JIRA (production) system.
# Create an XML backup in the production system.
# Attempt to restore it onto the test system.
The following page is displayed:
!backup_restore.jpg|thumbnail!

_Note_, there is no _enough_ warning that the restore process is about to reuse the existing index directory and associate it also with the test instance. Running two JIRA instance against index is known to cause all sort of obscure behaviour of the application.

We should implement a check if the directory is already in use and  ask the user to confirm his choice or move index to 'jira home', similarly to the invalid path warning:

!Data_Import.png!
fields.summary: Backup restore silently overwrites index dir if test instance coexist with production system

{{{color:#AAAAAA}Formatting in Jira.JPG{color}}}

||
h4. Steps to reproduce
- Go to Jira
- Create 
- Select Project and Issue type
- Next
- Enter Summary
- Enter Description with '*' for list with bullets
- Click preview
- Click wiki makeup help
- Save

On the Issues Search page, there are fields for filtering by Created, Updated, Due, and Resolved dates. It would be extremely useful if I could filter by the Fix Version release date.

Each Version in a JIRA project has an optional Release Date field. If that release date is set, I'd like to be able to filter on it. So, like the Updated Date fields in Issues Search allows for explicit or relative date values, I'd like to be able to create a query based on a Fix Version's release date.

So instead of saying "Updated After" below, it would say "Fix Version Release Date After" or something.

Example:
Our developers work on multiple projects that each have their own version release dates. I would like to create a filter for my developers where it shows all issues that have a Fix Version release date between now and 1 month in the future.

fields.description:
OSGi (v2) plugins that ship by default with JIRA wait 60 seconds for JIRA to start up and load the necessary plugins that these plugins depend on.
If JIRA takes longer than 60 seconds to start up, these plugins will start timing out and fail to load giving errors such as the below one.

{noformat}
2010-10-28 00:07:26,109 main ERROR      [atlassian.plugin.manager.PluginEnabler] Unable to start the following plugins due to timeout while waiting for plugin to enable: com.atlassian.gadgets.renderer,com.atlassian.jira.gadgets,com.atlassian.gadgets.oauth.serviceprovider,com.atlassian.gadgets.embedded,com.atlassian.streams.streams-jira-plugin,com.atlassian.gadgets.dashboard
2010-10-28 00:07:36,543 Timer-0 WARN      [internal.dependencies.startup.DependencyWaiterApplicationContextExecutor] Timeout occurred before finding service dependencies for [OsgiBundleXmlApplicationContext(bundle=com.atlassian.jira.gadgets, config=osgibundle:/META-INF/spring/*.xml)]
2010-10-28 00:07:36,582 Timer-0 ERROR      [internal.dependencies.startup.DependencyWaiterApplicationContextExecutor] Unable to create application context for [com.atlassian.jira.gadgets], unsatisfied dependencies: Dependency on [(objectClass=com.atlassian.gadgets.dashboard.DashboardService)] (from bean [&dashboardService]), Dependency on [(objectClass=com.atlassian.gadgets.view.GadgetViewFactory)] (from bean [&gadgetViewFactory])
org.springframework.context.ApplicationContextException: Application context initialization for 'com.atlassian.jira.gadgets' has timed out
	at org.springframework.osgi.extender.internal.dependencies.startup.DependencyWaiterApplicationContextExecutor.timeout(DependencyWaiterApplicationContextExecutor.java:462)
	at org.springframework.osgi.extender.internal.dependencies.startup.DependencyWaiterApplicationContextExecutor.access$000(DependencyWaiterApplicationContextExecutor.java:51)
	at org.springframework.osgi.extender.internal.dependencies.startup.DependencyWaiterApplicationContextExecutor$WatchDogTask.run(DependencyWaiterApplicationContextExecutor.java:108)
	at java.util.TimerThread.mainLoop(Timer.java:512)
	at java.util.TimerThread.run(Timer.java:462)
2010-10-28 00:07:36,589 Timer-0 ERROR      [extender.internal.activator.ContextLoaderListener] Application context refresh failed (OsgiBundleXmlApplicationContext(bundle=com.atlassian.jira.gadgets, config=osgibundle:/META-INF/spring/*.xml))
org.springframework.context.ApplicationContextException: Application context initialization for 'com.atlassian.jira.gadgets' has timed out
	at org.springframework.osgi.extender.internal.dependencies.startup.DependencyWaiterApplicationContextExecutor.timeout(DependencyWaiterApplicationContextExecutor.java:462)
	at org.springframework.osgi.extender.internal.dependencies.startup.DependencyWaiterApplicationContextExecutor.access$000(DependencyWaiterApplicationContextExecutor.java:51)
	at org.springframework.osgi.extender.internal.dependencies.startup.DependencyWaiterApplicationContextExecutor$WatchDogTask.run(DependencyWaiterApplicationContextExecutor.java:108)
	at java.util.TimerThread.mainLoop(Timer.java:512)
	at java.util.TimerThread.run(Timer.java:462)
{noformat}

If it happens that one of the core plugins times out e.g. REST all depended plugins such as gadgets, activity stream will fail to load. Ultimately the application will start up in an obscure way and we are leaving users without any feedback about it. 


Most customer report similar problem if JIRA takes longer to start up for e.g. due to under-performing hardware or virtualistaion infrastructure.

Unfortunately, at this stage the workaround is behaviour is to restart JIRA and allows it to reinitialise the plugin framework.


If one of the core plugins isn't initiated correctly, we should lock up the application and notify the user about this problem by dropping warring into the log file: 

{noformat}
******************************************
JIRA startup failed, JIRA has been locked.
******************************************
{noformat}

and UI message:

!lockedup.png!
fields.summary: JIRA starts up in unworkable stage if core plugin is not started

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-22632].
  {panel}

Supports heavily relies on goodness of modz detector. However, in SAC we observe customers who for some reason modify the hash file, which prevent correct diagnose of reported problems. 

Due to misleading output of modz detector, the reported problems are misdiagnosed causing delays and customer frustrations. Also, those support requests Support needs do spend a lot of time on analysing the source code and often look for assistance from developers.

We could improve the current implementation by either:
- signing the hash file,
- downloading its hash value or even the file directly from Atlassian.
fields.summary: Modz detector should be improved to prevent 'false positive' due to customisation of the hash file

fields.description:
We have a project with 1785 versions as of now and when we try to manage them in the admin panel, the browser become extremely slow. Scrolling with the mouse or with the bar takes several seconds, clicking Archive, Delete etc. also takes several seconds. Just loading the page with all the versions is extremely slow.

The issue is present on Chrome, IE, Firefox and Safari on a 2.66Ghz Quad Core, 8GB of ram PC and also on slower or faster PCs on both Windows XP, 7.

The only workaround is to modify them directly in the database but it would be much more efficient if our users could do it themselves in the admin panel instead of having to ask us to go in the database and change whatever they need.
fields.summary: Having a lot of versions (1700+) makes managing them impossible because the browser becomes extremely slow

fields.description:
The standalone JIRA instances have had help path links to Atlassian's online help is broken.

Example:
* In Jira 4.1.2, the link to "Online Help" in the User menu at the top right of every page goes to http://docs.atlassian.com/jira/docs-041/Home?clicked=jirahelp
* This is redirected to http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA041/Home?clicked=jirahelp
* Which in turn gives a "Home (Page Not Found)" error but with a link to where the documentation really is: http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA041/JIRA+Documentation

This is also the case for other "context sensitive help" links. For instance the one on the "Manage Filters" page link is broken.
fields.summary: help-paths.properties links Atlassian's online help need to be updated to reflect new addresses

fields.description:
The source build of Jira 4.2 depends on google-gson 1.4. This dependency can't be resolved via {https://m2proxy.atlassian.com/repository/m1/com.google.code.gson/jars/} since the jar file itself is missing, while the sha1 file is there. There is also an gson-1.4.pom available.

Please ensurce the consistency of the Maven repository.
fields.summary: Missing dependency for source build of Jira 4.2 (Gson)

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
1. Search for some issues on Issue Navigator
2. Go to the Issue Navigator.
3. On the Issue Navigator, select from the Views pull-down menu: Excel (current fields)
4. Open the Excel file in Excel
5. Observe that the column Issue Type shows the issue key and the Issue Type.

If instead of Exporting Search Results to Microsoft Excel(current fields) you choose Exporting Search Results to Microsoft Excel(all fields), the columns are exported correctly.


*Note*: an empty row is inserted between the issues listed on the .xls file (current fields or all fields is the same behaviour).
fields.summary: Excel Export adds the issue key to the Project column & an extra blank row between records

fields.description:
After the last update, the "Show Saved Filter" gadget started to truncate some filter columns. Basically, I configured the gadget to show the following columns: Key, Summary and Status. In our system, both Status and Summary fields are normally big(sometimes, the key is big too), so it's very irritating be able to see only "half" of the needed information. Before the update, the Key and the Status column occupied the necessary spaces(without line breaks) and the summary column had line breaks when needed.

Just as a example, here is the "correct"  and the "wrong"(truncated) filter:
(*Note:* The text itself is in Brazilian Portuguese - yeah, we know our language is quite verbose sometimes.)

Correct:
||Key||Summary||Status||
|GMI-123|Numeração de NF|Tarefa Parada|
|CEZAN-1|Relatórios de Necessidades Gerais (012348635)| Tarefa Liberada|
|CEZAN-2|Bug nas transações Oracle/SQL Server| Tarefa em Andamento|

Wrong
||Key||Summary||Status||
|GMI-12|Numeração de NF|Taref|
|CEZAN-|Relatórios de Necessidades Gerais (012348635)| Taref|
|CEZAN-|Bug nas transações Oracle/SQL Server| Taref|

I noticed that this problem occurs in Opera 10.63. In IE 8, everything is working flawlessly(as in 4.1). Note that is not possible to simply "switch to IE" because some of our users(myself included) use only Linux.
fields.summary: Minor bug in "Filter Results" gadget
Option to hide inactive workflows in the view workflow screen.

fields.description:
Hi,

in order to keep all the issues under better control, I could think of the following feature: in a standard e-mail web interface, when one gets a new e-mail, the message header in the mails list is marked in bold characters ("unread e-mail"). Once the user reads the e-mail, the bold formatting disappears.

Taking the e-mail example, for Jira it would be very useful to have the following mechanism:

On the list of issues assigned to me, if a issue gets an update made by somebody, then the issue gets marked with bold characters ("unread"). Once I open the issue, the marking with bold formatting disappears. The issue can get bold again if someone adds comments/makes modifications. The issue does not get bold if I (the assignee of the issue) add comments or make modifications.

Thanks,

Marco Boccioli
fields.summary: Mark updated issues as "unread"

fields.description:
After upgrade jira to 4.2 version I found out problem on report configuration screen. I have report with 2 select boxes in cascade:
{noformat}
...
            <property>
                <key>projectid</key>
                <name>report.cs.project</name>
                <description>report.cs.project.description
                </description>
                <type>select</type>
                <values class="com.atlassian.jira.portal.ProjectValuesGenerator"/>
            </property>
            <property>
                <key>version</key>
                <name>report.cs.version</name>
                <description>report.cs.version.description
                </description>
                <type>cascadingselect</type>
                <cascade-from>projectid</cascade-from>
                <values class="sk.eea.jira.plugin.report.ProjectsVersionCascadingValuesGenerator"/>
            </property>
....
{noformat}
Firefox 3.6.11 problem: There is no options in Projects selectbox and there are all versions of all projects in Version selectbox as you can see in attachment.
IE8 problem: There is no visible Version selectbox and navigation (Next, Cancel) buttons on screen as you can see at attachment.
Opera 10.63 and IE7 has no problem - everything works as before upgrade to jira 4.2.

I have done some research and I found out, that javascript function dynamicSelect(id1, id2) from cascadingutil.js is called with wrong parameters for firefox.
Firefox alert:   "id1: undefined_select  id2: projectid_select"
IE8 aler:          "id1: projectid_select  id2: version_select"
Opera alert:    "id1: projectid_select  id2: version_select"

In my opinion there is wrong resolving of hidden parameters paramCascadeFrom and paramName from <fieldset> elements of generated HTML code (html as attachment) in firefox.
fields.summary: Cascading select doesn't work in firefox and ie8

fields.description:
In a screen configuration the fields can be grouped into tabs as [documented here|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Defining+a+Screen#DefiningaScreen-ConfiguringTabs].

The problem is that on the view issue screen the date/time fields are displayed on the right hand side and not under the tabs. Screen configuration should not be ignored and the fields should appear under the tabs.

fields.description:
Today JIRA notifications only exist at issue level, not at project (version) level, so it is impossible to be notified when the release date of any version of a project is changed.

I tried creating custom events, but events can only be triggered on workflow transition post functions, and this is at issue level. It would be great if JIRA had notifications at project level.

Please let me know if you need further explanation.

Regards,
____________________
Felipe Kraemer
Atlassian Support

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-22600].
  {panel}

Hi,

Due to a security 'issue' JRA-21232, a major piece of functionality that is used by our company has been removed. This has been raised 'but dismissed' in JSP-66660.

Basically we have a large amount (10TB+) of attachments currently stored on an external RAID array, whilst the installation of JIRA is on a relatively small SSD in our server. The change implemented in JRA-21232 will force us (in new JIRA instances) to put all the attachments in the home directory, aka on the SSD. 

Clearly this does not suit how we use JIRA and looks like a major regression in functionality. My i recommend that for private JIRA's like ours we should be able to use the admin GUI to put attachments, log files etc on any UNC path we want.
fields.summary: Please support attachments, logs etc not in the home path of a JIRA install. (caused by JRA-21232)

Currently, the project import feature allows you to import a single project from a site backup, but the backup must have been taken from the exact same version of JIRA.  It would be helpful to be able to bring in projects from an older version of JIRA and have a tailored equivalent of the upgrade process bring the data up to date.

fields.description:
Currently Jira allows dates in the past to be entered in the "Due Date" field.  According to JRA-20529 this is desired behavior.  The ability to enter dates in the past should be configurable with the option to not allow past dates.  

It would be even cooler if this could be configurable on a per-project basis or if you could declare which date field maps to the "due date" functionality on a per-project basis.
fields.summary: Make past "Due Date" dates configurable

Note that windows explorer does still open.
This only happens when I there's very little delay (~250ms) between holding down the Windows key and pressing E, but be assured, I'm not pressing them out of order, otherwise I'd get my start menu instead of windows explorer.

fields.description:
From the [documentation|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA041/Creating+Issues+and+Comments+from+Email#CreatingIssuesandCommentsfromEmail-HandlerParameters], when the "reporterusername" is specified, the "from" address of the email is added at the end of the comment of the issue.

This is tested not working for JIRA 3.13.x, 4.0.x, 4.1.x and 4.2

It only work for the issue creation.

There is even a [FAQ|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Appending+Email+Addresses+to+Comments+Made+by+Anonymous+Users+when+Using+a+Mail+Handler] to append the email address to the comment.

The line "the "from" address of the email is added at the end of the comment of the issue" from the [documentation|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA041/Creating+Issues+and+Comments+from+Email#CreatingIssuesandCommentsfromEmail-HandlerParameters] should be removed.
fields.summary: Incorrect documentation for handle parameter "reporterusername"

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-22582].
  {panel}

When validating dates JIRA rejects dates as invalid if the the date is the start date of daylight savings time daylight savings time transitions at midnight in the system's timezone.

Effected dates and timezones include the following in the year 2010:
Cannot parse "21/03/2010": Illegal instant due to time zone offset transition (America/Havana)
Cannot parse "17/10/2010": Illegal instant due to time zone offset transition (America/Asuncion)
Cannot parse "17/10/2010": Illegal instant due to time zone offset transition (America/Campo_Grande)
Cannot parse "17/10/2010": Illegal instant due to time zone offset transition (America/Cuiaba)
Cannot parse "10/10/2010": Illegal instant due to time zone offset transition (America/Santiago)
Cannot parse "10/10/2010": Illegal instant due to time zone offset transition (Antarctica/Palmer)
Cannot parse "10/10/2010": Illegal instant due to time zone offset transition (America/Santiago)
Cannot parse "17/10/2010": Illegal instant due to time zone offset transition (America/Argentina/Buenos_Aires)
Cannot parse "17/10/2010": Illegal instant due to time zone offset transition (America/Argentina/Cordoba)
Cannot parse "17/10/2010": Illegal instant due to time zone offset transition (America/Argentina/Tucuman)
Cannot parse "17/10/2010": Illegal instant due to time zone offset transition (America/Sao_Paulo)
Cannot parse "28/03/2010": Illegal instant due to time zone offset transition (America/Scoresbysund)
Cannot parse "28/03/2010": Illegal instant due to time zone offset transition (Atlantic/Azores)
Cannot parse "30/04/2010": Illegal instant due to time zone offset transition (Africa/Cairo)
Cannot parse "25/03/2010": Illegal instant due to time zone offset transition (Asia/Amman)
Cannot parse "28/03/2010": Illegal instant due to time zone offset transition (Asia/Beirut)
Cannot parse "02/04/2010": Illegal instant due to time zone offset transition (Asia/Damascus)
Cannot parse "01/04/2010": Illegal instant due to time zone offset transition (Asia/Gaza)
Cannot parse "30/04/2010": Illegal instant due to time zone offset transition (Africa/Cairo)
Cannot parse "22/03/2010": Illegal instant due to time zone offset transition (Asia/Tehran)
Cannot parse "01/04/1981": Illegal instant due to time zone offset transition (Europe/Minsk)

This is a direct result of the date being treated as a time with the time portion being set to 00:00:00.  On the day of transition to daylight saving the times between 00:00:00 and 00:59:59 don't exist and so the date is rejected.
fields.summary: JIRA does not allow entry of dates for the Daylight Savings Transition date in timezones where the transition occurs at midnight.
Not all tables created when setting up with Postgres 8.4

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-22578].
  {panel}

I have configured Jira to authenticate via Crowd, which works fine by the way. But suddenly the login stopped working and the error 
"An internal server error occurred when requesting resource http://[domain].com:8080/rest/gadget/1.0/login." is instead shown in a popup. It turned out that my Crowd evaluation license had ended which caused this error. (I will by the starter license by the way. ;)

*How to reproduce:*
1) Configure Jira to authenticate via your Crowd installation.
2) Make sure Crowd has a evaluation license that has ended, and message "License Too Old For Build error" should be shown on the Crowd login page.
3) Do a login attempt and the error message above will be shown.

*Actual result:*
Error message "An internal server error occurred when requesting resource http://[domain].com:8080/rest/gadget/1.0/login." is shown in a popup. Users are unable to login when this happens.

*Suggested result:*
Display a descriptive message that clearly indicates that it is a problem with the Crowd installation. Something in the line of "Unable to authenticate via Crowd. Check your crowd installation.".
fields.summary: More userfriendly error message when unable to authenticate via Crowd

fields.description:
When creating issue with the cascading select custom field, there is no instruction on how to get the "Parent Option Id" and "Child Option Id". This is the example shown in the doc:

{noformat}
<JiraJelly xmlns:jira="jelly:com.atlassian.jira.jelly.JiraTagLib">
<jira:CreateIssue project-key="ABC" summary="Issue summary">
<jira:AddCustomFieldValue id="customfield_10000" value="field value"/>
<jira:AddCustomFieldValue name="Environment Select list" value="Windows XP"/>

<!-- For Cascading Selects : Note also that the value for cascading selects is the optionId-->
<jira:AddCustomFieldValue id="customfield_10001" value="Parent Option Id" />
<jira:AddCustomFieldValue id="customfield_10001" value="Child Option Id" key="1" />

<!-- For Version Pickers and Single Version Pickers : Note also that the value for version pickers is the versionId-->
<jira:AddCustomFieldValue id="customfield_10002" value="Version Id"/>

<!-- For Multi Selects -->
<jira:AddCustomFieldValue id="customfield_10003" value="Value 1" />
<jira:AddCustomFieldValue id="customfield_10003" value="Value 2" />

<!-- For Multi User Pickers : Note also that the value for multi user pickers is a comma separated list of users-->
<jira:AddCustomFieldValue id="customfield_10004" value="User 1,User 2" />

</jira:CreateIssue>
</JiraJelly>
{noformat}

It would be good if there is an instruction showing the user how to get the customfield Id, Parent Option Id, Child Option Id
fields.summary: Update the doc to show on how to get the "Parent Option Id" and "Child Option Id" when creating issue with the cascading select field

fields.description:
I have a couple of dashboards with about 14 Filter Results gadgets configured (each with default fields + due date and fix for displayed).

There is a pause in JavaScript when issues in these gadgets are clicked (the issue row in the table, including the link) on - i.e. the UI blocks after clicking until a JavaScript onclick event handler is executed.

The pause time appears to be related to the number of issues displayed on the dashboard, but it appears that it's worse than linear growth.

Comparing the pause times on Firefox 3.5, Google Chrome 8 and IE 8 gives you different pause times, in proportion to what you'd expect from the speed of the various JS engines, so it appears the pause is pure JavaScript execution.

The pause time on my i5 Macbook Pro is:
* Firefox 3.5 is 3-5 seconds
* Chromium 8 1-2 seconds
* IE 8 (gave up waiting after about 16 secs)

The other interesting thing is that the pause time is different depending on whether you click on an issue in the left column of the dashboard or the right. The pause is approximately a third longer for the left column compared to the right.

This is a serious problem as it blocks all user interaction (including opening issue links).
The workaround at the moment is to split up the dashboard until it drops down to acceptable pause levels.
fields.summary: JavaScript pauses in dashboard pages with many Filter Results gadgets

fields.description:
The loading of the field layout cache is not properly synchronized, leading to major performance issues for large customers with many custom fields.

Because the reloading of the cache is not synchronized, when a large number of requests arrive more or less simultaneously they all try and initialize the cache simultaneously. This is exacerbated by the fact that a dashboard may contain a number of filter results which will each try and reload the cache in parallel.
The end result is a complete overloading of the system. You can see from the attached thread dump over 100 different requests all trying to load the field layout cache simultaneously.
fields.summary: The loading of the field layout cache is not properly synchronized, leading to major performance issues for large customers with many custom fields.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-22571].
  {panel}

An invalid language preference will cause a stack trace for a user whenever
they attempt to view a profile. Initial testing shows that this error only
affects the user who inputs the invalid data.

STR
1. Visit http://localhost:8080/projects/secure/ViewProfile.jspa
2. Click the edit icon next to preferences
3. Modify the Language dropdown with burp/firebug so that the value attribute
has special characters such as ' > <
4. Save
5. You should get a stack trace after being redirected to your profile

Recommended remediation
The Language preference should only allow known Languages to be inputted. An
invalid language selection should default back to English.
fields.summary: Language preference is not validated causing exception on invalid data
Method under Administration-->Browser Users to allow options to control which domain(s) are used for authentication
